result.execSummary:
All charges against Anthony Earl McCullum in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Earl McCullum is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Earl McCullum

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Anthony Earl McCullum.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court upon request from the parties.  On State's motion, Court ordered case DISMISSED.
Received and Filed:  State's Letter to the Court.

Defendant Anthony Earl McCullum in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Anthony Earl McCullum.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial.  Defense filed a motion to suppress.  State requests an adjournment.  Court vacated jury trial set for today and scheduled a motion hearing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-12-2022
Received and Filed.

Defendant Anthony Earl McCullum in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Case remains in trial posture.  State's offer stated on the record and rejected by the defendant.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial remains scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-08-2022

Defendant Anthony Earl McCullum in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 7-15-2022 and all responses to be filed by 8-5-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-10-2022

Defendant Anthony Earl McCullum in court with attorney Jade K Hall, both appearing via Zoom.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:04 AM. Case in Court for a status. Defense requests an adjournment. Court set matter as requested. Court ordered State to turn over police reports by June 9, 2022. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
22RM021244  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 04/16/2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.

Attorney Colleen Cullen in court, defendant Anthony Earl McCullum not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for status in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner, Br. 38.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Anthony Earl McCullum in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen on behalf of Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Anthony Earl McCullum in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of defendant's prior conviction regarding case 04CF3450. Sworn for the State: Detective El Tucker - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Colleen Cullen; filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered  no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony Earl McCullum in court with Student Intern Alexia Giantisos under the supervision of attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Anthony Earl McCullum in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Earl McCullum appeared by video means with Attorney.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
